Deathbulge: Battle of the Bands looked funny and all, but it’s a turn-based RPG, a subgenre that usually elicits the same amount of enthusiasm from me as the phrase "by Ernest Cline" does from Alice. Deathbulge, however, is a clever little sod of a game, managing to devise not only a turn-based combat system that avoids the usual waiting-around tedium but one that’s outright good fun in itself.
Read more
articles.title: Deathbulge: Battle of the Bands' greatest trick is making me enjoy turn-based combat

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
There are management games and there are micro-management games. Prison Architect 2 is the latter. I don't mean this as an annoying thing, like when Harold from corporate starts commenting all over your document at 4.30pm on a Friday. I mean it as a distinction between those games that let you plop down a house, and others that need you to stack the bricks, install the plumbing, fit the lights, and select the wallpaper. The first Prison Architect allowed you to finesse every detail of a secure correctional facility, down to each cell and dog kennel. Unsurprisingly for a sim about prison, it encouraged obsessive control. The 3D-ified sequel isn't finished yet, but it's taking a similar approach. Maybe a little too similar.
Read more
articles.title: Prison Architect 2 is coming up for release, but it's hard to rehabilitate from years of 2D

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
You remember the ending of 2011's first-person bullethoser Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3, right? Everyone does! A big man kills another big man with a gun but then - then! - a third big man kills that first big man with a rope. It's dramatic stuff. Well, a data-diving enthusiast of the CoDwars has discovered a cut ending from the original trilogy's closing chapter. It's a more downbeat and mysterious finale, featuring a shadowy figure whose identity is never revealed. Also, Captain Price, the hero of the franchise and aforementioned big man number three, drops his cigar with possibly mortal implications.
Read more
articles.title: Captain Price seems to die in a cut ending from Modern Warfare 3, uncovered 13 years later

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 and Divinity Original Sin developers Larian today announced the opening of a new studio in Warsaw, Poland. This is RPG outfit Larian’s seventh studio worldwide, and the latest to contribute to their "24-hour development cycle" model. That’s even more hands on deck to a) keep Swen Vincke’s armour polished to a fine sheen and b) ensure smooth sailing for the two new games that Larian currently have in the works.
 
Read more
articles.title: Larian's new Polish studio is a "match made in heaven" for the Baldur's Gate 3 developer's upcoming RPGs

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
20 years after leaving Elder Scrolls, Starfield, and Fallout 76 makers Bethesda Game Studios, veteran writer and quest designer Douglas Goodall has returned to classic RPG Morrowind with an expansive new quest mod.
 
Read more
articles.title: Veteran Morrowind quest designer returns to the setting they helped build with a huge mod project

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This week on RPS: secret plans and clever tricks. Also, a bunch of new videogames, none of them particularly Enormous or Crocodilian. We open on Monday 20th May with the extremely Alice B-friendly combo of Little-Known Galaxy, aka Stardew Valley meets Star Trek, and A Tower Full Of Cats, a hidden object puzzler featuring a tower full of dogs, I mean cats. All very upbeat. Well, hold that thought, because on the 21st, it's time for Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2, another slice of Celtic sort-of-psychosis from Ninja Theory, which is as grim as the accompanying Paper Trail is *checks Nic's review* incredibly annoying?
  
Read more
articles.title: The Maw - 20th-25th May 2024

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! Did you know that the word ‘book’ is actually an ancient Sumerian greeting, short for: ‘can I have that book back I lent you eight months ago you said you’d have finished in like, two? This is going to be another one of those, isn’t it?.’ Truly, language’s many permutations are a font of limitless wonder. This week, it’s Pony Island, The Hex, and Inscryption maker Daniel Mullins! Cheers Daniel! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
 
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Inscryption and Pony Island's Daniel Mullins

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for wheeling my old gamer chair to the curb, before flopping back in my new ergonomic office chair  with the same awful posture and whining, "Why doesn't it work?! Who knew that furniture named things like Titan, Pro and Conquer aren't the most conducive to lumbar support?" Before I go, "Aaaaaaahhhhhhh" so loudly I give the local cats tiny heart attacks, let's read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Seablip is a pixel art pirate 'em up, which promises an open world to sail around, islands to visit, crews to hire, bounties to hunt, and minigames through which to uncover treasure and fish. It looks adorable and it's out in Early Access now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Seablip is a pixel art pirate 'em up out now in Early Access

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Dead Cells was blessed with several excellent animated trailers, each one produced by French animation studio Bobbypills. Now the slick metroidvania is getting a full animated television series from the same folks, and the first trailer is below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Here's the first trailer for the Dead Cells animated series

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The next Call Of Duty will arrive on Game Pass on day one, according to anonymous sources. Microsoft's strategy has long involved releasing all their first-party games on Game Pass, but there had been doubt over whether the same would be true of the first Call Of Duty to be released since Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of publishers Activision.

 
Read more
articles.title: The next Call Of Duty will launch on Game Pass on day one, reports say

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Redfall is getting a final update which will add an offline mode and singleplayer pausing, among other changes. The news was announced via the Redfall account on X, which also thanked players for their "supportive messages" in light of developer Arkane Austin's imminent closure by Microsoft.

 
Read more
articles.title: Redfall will receive one final update after all, including an offline mode

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
This weekend is a big one for me. My brand new fancy shmancy ottoman bed is arriving in my new flat, after two weeks of curling up on the sofa with a weighted blanket. I'll also be topping it with my brand new ultra-thick memory foam mattress topper, raising me off the floor another crucial few inches. Think of the view I'll get from up there! To imagine there'll be any time for games! Pah!
I kid. Plenty of time for games for us all, even while reclining on gloriously beds with ungodly amounts of storage space. We love playing games here at Rock Paper Shotgun. Even Alice, who has routinely told me that actually there are no good games. Here's what we'll be clicking on this weekend.
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
War never changes, and either does Fortnite's love of a crossover. Thus, Fallout and Fortnite are colliding as the post-apocalyptic RPG heads to the battle royale shooter’s upcoming next season.
Read more
articles.title: Fallout is headed to Fortnite’s next season

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
As you might’ve heard, Hades 2 is out in early access, offering up the much-anticipated sequel to Supergiant’s mythical (and delightfully thirsty) roguelite. Though the sheer amount of polish and Stuff in even its pre-release form might have you thinking that a full 1.0 release can’t be too far down the line, the game’s creative director reckons we’ve still got around a year to wait before it’s considered all finished up.
Read more
articles.title: Hades 2 will likely be in early access until 2025, with first big update to add new enemies, maps and features

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
If you’ve been wondering what Valve’s been working on as their next game after Counter-Strike 2, the answer may be at hand. Details and screenshots for Deadlock, a third-person hero shooter with MOBA elements, have seemingly leaked out of a recent closed playtest, revealing a blend of Overwatch, Dota 2 and Valve’s own Team Fortress 2.
Read more
articles.title: Looks like Valve’s next game is Deadlock, a multiplayer shooter-MOBA mix of Overwatch, Dota and Team Fortress

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Around a week after Microsoft shuttered a number of beloved studios with a track record of making excellent single-player, story-driven games, their newly-owned arm of Activision has revealed a brand new studio. Working on a new series of story-driven, triple-A games.
Read more
articles.title: Activision unveil new studio working on ‘narrative AAA franchise’, days after Microsoft shut Prey and Evil Within devs

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
I love building games, but it's not that often that put one down and feel particularly tempted to get straight back into it again. Of Life And Land is one of those, but thankfully not so much so that it threatens to consume my every waking moment.
It quietly does several things in a modest little way, that are all the more impressive for its lack of fanfare. The core one though, is that it takes the kind of simulationist foundation normally reserved for the punishing Dwarf Fortress derivatives or gnarly logistics games, and builds on them an approachable, gentle, even philosophical game instead. In a word: it's lovely.
Read more
articles.title: Warm, relaxing town builder Of Life and Land has some impressive sim chops

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Ghost of Tsushima: Director’s Cut is now out and about on PC, sadly with the requirement of signing into a PlayStation Network (PSN) account in order to play the samurai action-adventure’s Legends co-op mode. The same requirement, you might recall, that Helldivers 2 players recently lobbied Sony into abandoning. No such luck here, and as previously warned, the need for said PSN sign-in to happen over Windows means that Ghost of Tsushima is essentially missing a chunk of itself on the Steam Deck.
Read more
articles.title: Ghost of Tsushima runs well on Steam Deck, making its PSN nonsense all the more annoying

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
“In one of Nero’s many manifests,” reads a books in surreal puzzle-box Lorelei And The Laser Eyes, referring to its eccentric (read: tastefully deranged) antag-artist, “there is a satirical proposal claiming that only dictators should be allowed to direct films.” Developers Simogo - of well-deserved Sayonara Wild Hearts and Device 6 acclaim - seem to agree that’s a position worth satirising. Lorelei, despite its single-solution puzzles, is not dictatorial. It’s far too interested in collaborating with you for that. It wants you to observe, consider, and interpret its many mysteries. What’s really hooked me here is how those puzzles are kept coherent and logical, despite you getting delivered a letter by dog and occasionally visiting a floppy disk bizzaro world where you converse with a magician who manifests from his own discarded hat.
Read more
articles.title: Lorelei And The Laser Eyes doesn’t let its surreal creativity strip its puzzles of logic

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Have you played Homeworld 3 yet? I have. I thought it was *gestures at review*. I bring it up because, as is often your way, the readership commented me into thinking about something I’ve been wanting to cover: the outdated relic that is the easy/normal/hard difficulty trifecta. "Ohoho," I warbled chuckilishly. "I shall craft a blistering manifesto, sharper than the apex of a Toblerone on the roof of your mouth when you try to eat it as god intended. I will solve this problem." And then I thought, "Actually, no. That sounds hard." So, instead, here are some wazzock-tier ramblings.
 
Read more
articles.title: Nando's does difficulty better than videogames

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Creative Assembly, the studio best known for their strategy Total War series, are rumoured to be working on a licensed Star Wars title. ‘Rumoured’ is the key word here, mind. Dualshockers credit “a reliable source” with the information that “three new Total War games are currently in development,” and that “one of the three new projects is expected to be a Star Wars-themed Total War game.” There’s currently no further information beyond that, I’m afraid, although I’ve reached out to Creative Assembly for comment.
 
Read more
articles.title: Rumours point to Total War: Star Wars in the works at Creative Assembly

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
You might remember Enotria: The Last Song as the Italian-inspired Soulslike that shifted its release date from June to August to avoid Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree... but found itself nestled next to Black Myth: Wukong. Well, scratch that August release, as now it's been shifted back to September instead! But hey, there's a demo coming out real soon that'll hopefully give us a better sense of what the game's like. I imagine it'll involve a lot of fighting spindly monsters, dying, and resurrecting at whatever object they've decided will be the equivalent of Dark Souls' bonfires. Likely something Leonardo da Vinci made or drew or invented. That man's stats were specced high.
Read more
articles.title: Summery Soulslike Enotria: The Last Song is delayed again, but there's an 8-hour demo coming soon

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
I've clocked up nearly 400 hours playing BioWare's big fantasy RPG Dragon Age: Inquisition, which is not a stat I'm particularly proud of. I'm not ashamed either, partly because, as has been identified by artist Corey Brickley, via the Maw, there's a lot of filler. Brickley has collated a list of suggested mods to slim down Dragon Age: Inquisition from a potentially 80 hours-long epic to a trim 40 hour story-focused romp, which means you might be able to play through it again in time for the launch of Dragon Age: Dreadwolf - which is a direct sequel to Inquisition.
I find this list of mods interesting! It's a way to change the game quite substantially without exactly transforming it, and it's very in-keeping with my campaign to make games 60% smaller. Still, there's at least one item on there I'd push back on, but also this isn't really a new problem for Dragon Age as a series.
Read more
articles.title: This handy list of mods makes Dragon Age: Inquisition short enough to play again before Dreadwolf comes out

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Open world crime-a-thon GTA 6 will release next “fall”, according to publisher Take-Two Interactive’s latest earning report, via Eurogamer. This narrows the previously announced release window of “2025” down by, uh, infinity I suppose? A year is an effectively endless stretch in terms of release calenders. But “Fall”, despite not being a real season, is something I can work with.
 
Read more
articles.title: The 'Grand Theft Auto 6' of Grand Theft Auto 6-likes, aka Grand Theft Auto VI, is coming next “fall"

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Hell-wandering roguelike Hades 2 has received its first proper patch, and it does everything the developers said it would. You now sprint faster and, significantly, you can gather more than one type of crafting resource per run (as long you've unlocked the tool that lets you gather that resource). This  means Melinoë can now go fishing, dig up seeds, mine silver, and gain the trust of errant shades, all in a single night's work. There is a catch though.
Read more
articles.title: First Hades 2 patch lets you gather seed, silver and souls simultaneously

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Being offered a 4X game for free is definitely one of those cursed-monkey-paw situations. Sure, you’re saving physical currency, but at what price in terms of that most treasured and least tradeable of commodities, time? In the hours it takes to properly clean out a 4X game, you could probably build an empire yourself. OK, not a huge empire. An empire the size of the Vatican or the Principality of Sealand, perhaps. Maybe an empire that only covers the distance between your desk and your fridge. But an empire nonetheless. Go on, pronounce yourself God-Tyrant of your bedroom while you download Amplitude’s Endless Legend, which is 100% off on Steam  till 10am PDT, 1pm EDT and 6pm BST on May 23rd.
 Read more
articles.title: Excellent 4X strategy sim Endless Legend is free on Steam for a week

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
There are exactly one million metroidy rogueishy action platform games and that is okay. There's no such thing as too many of an entertaining thing in a world with, god I dunno, at least thousand humans in? Maybe more? Who knows.
They are rarely my thing, though. I try more than I really want to, for you, and games like Biomorph give me the energy to keep going through the many that leave me indifferent. This isn't one of my grudging admissions that a subgenre isn't all bad; it's a game that I can't even think of a way to complain about.
Read more
articles.title: Biomorph is one the best of its genre, of 2024, and maybe all time

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Fans of odd games with multiple endings and themes of identity and oppression, rejoice! Or, maybe, not rejoice. Time will tell. In the latest issue of Japanese gaming magazine Famitsu, Yosuke Saito, the series producer for Nier, teased that he might be working on something new with Yoko Taro and Keiichi Okabe, the director and composer for the Nier series, respectively.
Via Gematsu and PCGamer, Saito said, “I’ve been talking about wanting to do something with Yoko and Okabe for some time now. I’ll have something a bit more put-together to say in the not-too-distant future, so please stay tuned. It might be NieR, it might not be NieR. (Laughs.) That’s about all I can say for now.” Thanks for the clarity, Saito.
Read more
articles.title: Big cool weirdo Yoko Taro may or may not be working on something that may or may not be Nier

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
When they’re not banding together to take on Sony or attempting to reinstate fired community managers, it turns out that Helldivers 2 players just want to make sure everyone feels included. Included in the co-op game’s endless war of attrition to protect Super Earth from bugs, robots, and basic awareness of military propaganda, and included in just having mates. Enter player ‘dremskiy’, whose tragic booting from a private game in which they just wanted to make friends has resulted in so many friend requests that their Steam account won’t accept any more.


 Read more
articles.title: Helldivers 2 players rally around an unlikely hero who just wanted to make friends

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Absurd Ventures, the company started by Rockstar Games co-founder and head writer Dan Houser after he left said juggernaut, are working on a new "open world action-adventure" game. That's according to recent job listings on Absurd's website (cheers Gamesradar for the spot), which mention such a thing. And to be honest, are any of us surprised? Not really. Will the finished product resemble GTA to some degree? I imagine yes. Am I happy about this? Yeah, go on then.
Read more
articles.title: Rockstar co-founder Dan Houser's new studio is making an "open world action-adventure" game

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Our Edders, the RPSer I’d most trust to help me gank a rival covenant member with hammers, reckoned Pinocchio soulslike Lies Of P was an “instant must-play” in his review, and I was pretty fond of it myself. We already know that we’re due a sequel at some point the future, thanks to impressive sales. Director Jiwon Choi previously teased some DLC concept art, and now it looks like we’ll be seeing that DLC by the time the year’s out, according to a fiscal report.
 
Read more
articles.title: Shockingly great soulslike Lies Of P is due a DLC by the end of the year

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
As Ubisoft revealed Assassin's Creed Shadows they also released their earnings report for the financial year 2023-2024. Buried among the chatter of "profitable growth trajectories" and "B2B partnerships" was a brief note about looter shooter The Division Heartland. "Ubisoft has decided to stop development on The Division Heartland," it reads, "and has redeployed resources to bigger opportunities such as XDefiant and Rainbow Six." Ah, so this is the games industry equivalent of being summarily dumped by text.
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft quietly cancel The Division Heartland

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
We’re just a couple of days away from Ghost of Tsushima’s PC release date, as the former PlayStation exclusive prepares to drop its Director's Cut - including its expansion and multiplayer DLC - on Steam. Having recently cleared up the question around whether you’ll need to sign in with a PSN account after the Helldivers 2 debacle - yes, if you want to play the co-op mode - developers Nixxes and Sucker Punch have now revealed that the login requirement will mean multiplayer won’t work on Steam Deck.
Read more
articles.title: Ghost of Tsushima’s PSN login requirement will stop you playing multiplayer on Steam Deck

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
After teasing an upcoming chapter inspired by Dungeons & Dragons, Dead by Daylight has revealed its next killer pulled from the pages of the fantasy pen-and-paper RPG: Vecna, long-running mega-baddie and inspiration for the Stranger Things villain. He’ll be voiced by Critical Role dungeon master Matthew Mercer and haunt a new dungeon map, where you’ll be able to do battle as new elf and bard survivors able to roll a literal d20 when they crack open treasure chests.
Read more
articles.title: Dead by Daylight is adding D&D killer Vecna, voiced by Critical Role DM Matthew Mercer, with Castlevania also on the way

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
After being unceremoniously thrown into the spotlight yesterday with a pre-reveal leak, Assassin’s Creed Shadows has been given a proper unveiling via a flashy cinematic trailer, confirming both its leaked November release date and revealing that we’ll be playing as two protagonists for the first time in the series since Syndicate almost a decade ago. One of those heroes will also be the series’ first playable real-life figure: the African samurai Yasuke.
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows is both a samurai and a ninja game, as it borrows Syndicate’s dual-character story

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Alzara Radiant Echoes is a clear love letter to golden age JRPGs, pulling inspiration from the likes of Golden Sun and Lost Odyssey for a 3D turn-based RPG set in a Mediterranean fantasy world. Dark Souls composer Motoi Sakuraba is on board, along with Genshin Impact and Fire Emblem artist Yoshiro Ambe. And if that hadn’t already sold me already, developers Studio Camelia are also paying tribute to the best Final Fantasy game: FFIX, obviously.
Read more
articles.title: "Inspired by FF9" is all I needed to sell me on JRPG tribute Alzara Radiant Echoes, but "Dark Souls composer" and "Genshin Impact artist" help too

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Remember when Control came out and your mate Terry appeared out of nowhere to rant endlessly about how they’ve always loved brutalist architecture? Come on, Terry. No you haven’t. You spend weekends eating custard creams and watching Bake Off. You haven’t thought about brutalism since undergrad, be honest. Anyway, my version of that is Starship Troopers. As in, I’ve been waiting for a videogamey excuse to bang on about it in public for ages. Helldivers 2 is obviously as good an excuse as any, but really, I needn’t have waited so long. Official offerings like strategy game Starship Troopers: Terran Command and FPS Robocop: Rogue City aside, I reckon you can find Paul Verhoeven’s fingerprints all over games.
 
Read more
articles.title: It’s not just Helldivers 2 - plenty of games owe a lot to the films of Paul Verhoeven

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Škuta)
articles.description: V redakci pravidelně testujeme notebooky od německé společnosti Tuxedo Computers. Kromě velkých herních notebooků a přenosných pracovních stanic nesmíme vynechat ani zástupce přenosných kancelářských strojů, kterým je je Tuxedo Pulse 14.
articles.title: Tuxedo Pulse 14 Gen 3 a Gen 4: pracovitá šedá myška do kanceláře

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V dnešní sklizni se podíváme na nástroje, které vám pomohou zabezpečit vaše digitální secrets, zefektivnit práci s API a udržet krok s nejnovějšími trendy ve světě open-source softwaru.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (29. 5. 2024): ukryjte dobře svá tajemství

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: Měli jste u osmibitu disketovou mechaniku? V předchozím článku jsem se věnoval pouhé teorii, v pokračování se již budu věnovat skutečnému hardwaru a tomu, jakou údržbu a servis mu dopřát.
articles.title: Disketová mechanika Commodore 1541-II: rozebrání a vyčistění

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes navážeme na článek Emergence: struktury vzniklé ze zdánlivého chaosu, ve kterém jsme si ukázali, jak si můžeme pomocí jednoduchých pravidel nechat vygenerovat komplexní systém. Toto téma souvisí s teorií chaosu a v této oblasti má výsadní postavení Lorenzův systém.
articles.title: Lorenzův systém: ideální pomůcka pro studium chaosu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: V tomto díle pravidelného bezpečnostního souhrnu se podíváme na problém nemizejících obrázků na zařízeních Apple, zranitelnosti v prohlížeči Google Chrome, záplaty v produktech od Ivanti a účinnost blokování IP adres.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: když smazané fotky neříkají doopravdy sbohem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt NetBSD zaujímá stanovisko k předkládání kódu napsaného umělou inteligencí. Firma Murena vydala novou verzi svého operačního systému pro mobilní zařízení /e/OS s číslem 2.0. Vyšel lehký správce oken IceWM 3.5.
articles.title: NetBSD mění přístup k AI, vyšel Murena /e/OS 2.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Coreboot 24.05 a dalších 25 platforem, PipeWire 1.2 a streamování na Snapcast servery, kampaň na HealthyPi Move, biometrické open-source hodinky, týden v KDE a nejen tripple-buffering na Waylandu.
articles.title: Open-source biometrické hodinky HealthyPi, Plasma 6.1 vylepšuje běh na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Novější Radeony i na platformě RISC-V, nadále bez upstream ovladače platformy Steam Deck, mizí dva zastaralé ovladače, AMD pracuje na Zen 5 v rámci Perf Tools.
articles.title: Novinky pro Linux 6.10: AMD Zen 5 či konec neudržovaných ovladačů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Součástí odborných textů běžně bývají ukázky programového kódu či konfiguračních souborů. Nejčastěji bývají sázeny neproporcionálním písmem, ale jsou i jiné možnosti. Pojďme se podívat, co v této oblasti nabízí LaTeX.
articles.title: Sazba zdrojových kódů v LaTeXu: balík fancyvrb

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na články o AOT překladačích (mypyc a Cython) i o JIT překladačích (Numba) dnes navážeme a celé téma dokončíme. Popíšeme si totiž některé možnosti nabízené AOT překladačem nazvaným Nuitka.
articles.title: Nuitka: pokročilý AOT překladač jazyka Python

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Štrobl)
articles.description: Kubernetes je spíše spjat s provozem aplikací, které nevyžadují úložiště, tzv. stateless. Jejich provoz je jednodušší, snáze se škálují a obecně rychleji startují. Nicméně, občas je úložiště potřeba a přesně o tom bude další Cloud Native Prague meetup s tématem zvaným Stateful Kubernetes.
articles.title: Cloud Native Prague #13: stateful Kuberenetes již zítra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát datovým analytikem s přesahem do datového inženýrství a v budoucnu se věnovat třeba i strojovému učení či AI? Pak je tu pro vás půlroční intenzivní kurz Datový analytik s Pythonem, kterým vás jednou týdně ve 24 lekcích provedou zkušení lektoři s komerční praxí.
articles.title: Staňte se datovým analytikem s Pythonem (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je nová verze AlmaLinux 8.10, která vychází z RHELu 8.10, nicméně oproti RHELu zpětně zavádí podporu některých RAID řadičů, kterou upstream RHELu vyřadil, skrze navrácení podpory pro některá PCI ID, kde není nutná změna kódu ovladače. AlmaLinux 8.10 tak víceméně dělá pro systémové správce strojů s těmito řadiči zhruba totéž, co AlmaLinux 9.4 oproti RHELu 9.4, navíc s tím bonusem, že se mohou nadále držet „osmičkové“ řady. Viz seznam inkriminovaných zařízení.
articles.title: AlmaLinux 8.10 též s RAID ovladači, které RHEL nepodporuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Čerstvá oprava pro kernelový nástroj cpupower odteď zajistí, že majitelé budoucích procesorů generace AMD Zen 5 budou mít k dispozici správně fungující reportování P-state frekvencí, tedy pracovní frekvence v (nejen) úsporných stavech chodu CPU.
articles.title: Oprava cpupower pro AMD Zen 5 míří do jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Canonical oznámila, že je k dispozici optimalizovaný obraz Ubuntu 24.04 pro Milk-V Mars, první výkonný jednodeskový počítač RISC-V (SBC) velikosti platební karty, který dodala společnost Shenzhen MilkV Technology.
articles.title: Ubuntu má podporu pro jednodeskový počítač s RISC-V zvaný Milk-V Mars

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost OVHcloud dnes oznámila spuštění své první pražské lokální zóny veřejného cloudu (Public Cloud Local Zone). Pražští zákazníci tak mají přístup ke cloudovým službám se sníženou latencí a lokálním umístěním dat. Nová zóna navíc plně odpovídá evropským předpisům o digitální suverenitě a bezpečnosti a splňuje přísné standardy organizací z finančního, bankovního nebo vládního sektoru, píše se v oznámení.
articles.title: OVHcloud spouští svou pražskou lokální zónu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: PeoplePath)
articles.description: Společnost PeoplePath pořádá v Plzni jednou za dva měsíce workshopy na různá IT témata. Tentokrát bylo hlavním tématem PHPUnit a byl pořízen videozáznam.
articles.title: Video z workshopu Úvod do testování s PHPUnit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený ovladač Intel iVPU pro NPU (Neural Processing Unit) od tohoto výrobce, které se objevily v procesorech aktuální mobilní řady Meteor Lake, prodělává refactoring. Vývojáři Intelu zaslali sadu patchů, která mění ovladač hardwarové vrstvy NPU tak, aby do budoucna flexibilněji sloužil různým konfiguracím NPU v procesorech Intel.
articles.title: Refactoring ovladače NPU Intel pro lepší práci CPU a NPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojář Mika Laitio hledal cestu jak si usnadnit používání balíku AMD ROCm a strojového učení na CPU a GPU AMD. Podařilo se mu vytvořit balík skriptů, který za uživatele zařídí hromadu ruční práce (sám instaluje a kompiluje dobrých 80 dílčích projektů) a vše udržuje v jednom projektovém adresáři, včetně vlastního buildu jazyka Python. Svůj projekt umístil na Github k volnému užití.
articles.title: ROCM SDK Builder, cesta jak instalovat Machine Learning od AMD pro běžná GPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včerejší finále mistrovství světa v ledním hokeji, kde česká reprezentace vyhrála zlaté medaile, přineslo i několik dalších rekordů. Peeringový uzel NIX.CZ ve 21:15 zaznamenal rekordní provoz 3,14 Tbps. Rekord zaznamenal i operátor O2, který zajišťoval internetové vysílání i pro Českou televizi. Zde ve 22:40 provoz překročil 3 Tbps.
articles.title: Při finále v hokeji tekl uzlem NIX.CZ rekordní provoz 3,14 Tbps

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Další ročník konference LinuxDays začal přijímat přednášky. Pokud máte co říct, můžete už teď přihlásit své téma. Organizátory zajímají především témata týkající se Linuxu, open source, sítí, bezpečnosti, vývoje a podobně. Mezi návštěvníky jsou jak začátečníci, tak i velmi zkušení odborníci. Nemusíte se tedy bát přidat své téma.
articles.title: Přihlaste přednášku na LinuxDays 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nintendo Switch je herní konzole založená na Nvidia Tegra X1 (4× ARM Cortex A57 1,02 GHz, 4 GB RAM, Nvidia Maxwell GPU). Pro Switch existuje neoficiální software Switchroot, který umožní spustit Linux nebo Android. Funguje i dualboot s oficiálním Switch OS.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04 na Nintendo Switch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jádro 6.10 bude podporovat zapečetění paměti mseal. Tuto funkci navrhl Jeff Xu, vývojář Chrome minulý rok v říjnu. Linus Torvalds měl k mseal některé výhrady, ty se ale podařilo postupně překonat.
articles.title: Jádro 6.10 bude podporovat zapečetění paměti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tomáš Heřmánek)
articles.description: Pokud vás zajímá monitoring, můžete využít série bezplatných webinářů a nově i workshopů zaměřených na nejnovější verzi Zabbixu 7.0. Přijďte a získejte podrobné informace o nových funkcích, praktické tipy a triky a osvědčené postupy, které vám pomohou optimalizovat vaše monitorovací řešení. Nepropásněte tuto příležitost posunout své znalosti Zabbixu na vyšší úroveň a dozvědět se vše nejen o nové verzi.
articles.title: Pozvánka na webináře o Zabbix 7.0: novinky a praktické workshopy zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Kdysi velmi populární nástroj pro zasílání zpráv ICQ bude 26. června definitivně vypnut. Služba ICQ je pojmenována podle anglického „I seek you“ a byla spuštěna v roce 1996, jen krátce před službou AOL Instant Messenger. Byla oblíbená pro své snadné používání, chatování s konkrétními uživateli nebo ve skupinách a možnost komunikovat s lidmi z celého světa v reálném čase a zdarma.
articles.title: ICQ končí, 26. června ho po 28 letech provozovatel vypne

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Box86 a Box64 jsou linuxové emulátory instrukcí x86 a x86_64. Umožňují tedy například běh Steamu a her na procesorech ARM. Mezi novinkami je dynamická detekce pagesize. Což umožní běh na Apple ARM a Raspberry Pi 5 (64bitové jádro), protože oba mají pagesize 16k, místo ve světě x86 běžných 4k.
articles.title: Nový Box86 0.3.6 a Box64 0.2.8 fungují na Apple ARM a na Raspberry Pi 5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno jsme tu měli změnu pro jádro 6.10, která umožní konfiguraci NFS serveru pomocí nového nástroje nfsdctl. Do jádra 6.10 směřuje ještě jedna změna pro NFS. Ve výchozím stavu bude vypnuto NFSv2 z roku 1989.
articles.title: Jádro 6.10 vypne ve výchozím nastavení NFSv2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na Steamu je možné získat zdarma hru Warhammer 40,000: Gladius – Relics of War. Jde o tahovou strategii ze série Warhammer 40,000.
articles.title: Zdarma na Steamu Warhammer 40,000: Gladius - Relics of War

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Microsoft v pondělí představil nový AI nástroj Recall, který bude ve Windows 11 a umožní uživateli vyhledávat ve svých minulých aktivitách. Dělá totiž průběžně snímky obrazovky. Při vyhledávání je také použito AI pro přepsání hlasu do textu ve videokonferencích nebo ve videích. Proto bude potřeba Copilot+ PC, které obsahuje NPU.
articles.title: Nový AI nástroj Recall ve Windows 11 bude dělat snímky obrazovky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Máte spravovat síťové prvky společnosti MikroTik, ale chybí vám potřebné znalosti a zkušenosti? Přijďte na naše školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a kromě všech důležitých informací si domů odnesete i vlastní router MikroTik.
articles.title: Přijďte na školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a odnesete si router

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Od dnešního rána nefunguje vyhledávač Microsoftu Bing (downdetector). Kvůli tomu vyhledávač DuckDuckGo (downdetector) nevrací žádné výsledky, protože  používá výsledky Bingu. Stejně tak nefunguje vyhledávání internetu v ChatGPT-4.
articles.title: Nefunguje Bing, Copilot, DuckDuckGo a ChatGPT - aktualizováno

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Byť je s námi USB už čtvrt století, stále jsou používány mnohé tiskárny a jiná zařízení připojované přes LPT, tedy paralelní port. Greg Kroah-Hartman tak mezi změny USB/Thunderbolt subsystému příští verze jádra začleňuje i patche, které přidávají nový ovladač pro další čip obsažený v adaptérech z USB na LPT.
articles.title: Linux 6.10 přinese nový ovladač pro další USB-LPT adaptéry

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po půl roce od předchozího vydání byla uvolněna nová pravidelná verze linuxové distribuce Alpine Linux, tentokrát s označením 3.20.0. Hlavní novinkou je tentokrát přidání podpory pro 64bitovou architekturu RISC-V. Seznam všech důležitých změn najdete v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Alpine Linux 3.20.0 přidává podporu pro 64bitovou architekturu RISC-V

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Ink)
articles.description: Společnost JetBrains vydala první oficiální verzi IDE pro jazyk Rust s názvem RustRover. Pro nekomerční použití je základní verze k dispozici zdarma.
articles.title: Vyšla první ostrá verze vývojového nástroje RustRover

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Studie HP Wolf Security odhaluje aktuálně využívané metody kyberútoků. Acer představuje svůj první Copilot+ notebook Swift 14 s umělou inteligencí. Fortinet představuje prvního bezpečnostního asistenta pro IoT s generativní umělou inteligencí. Dell Technologies představuje ochranu dat v multicloudu. Výkonný elektromagnet z 3D tiskárny.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Výkonný elektromagnet z 3D tiskárny

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 21/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Před 70 lety vznikl první křemíkový solární článek. Webbův dalekohled zachytil nejvzdálenější fúzi černých děr. Malé modulární jaderné reaktory se blíží do Česka. Z čeho se skládá kosmické záření. Nový výzkum spojuje kyslík s technologickou civilizací.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Neutronové molekuly – neutrony se mohou vázat na kvantové tečky

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Trh se službami cloudové infrastruktury zaznamenává již druhé čtvrtletí vyšší než očekávaný růst. Kyberzločinci zneužívají nové zranitelnosti o 43 % rychleji než před rokem. Polovina českých firem si není jistá blízkou budoucnosti svého oboru, většina ale počítá s velkým vlivem AI. Pure Storage a Red Hat urychlují zavádění moderní virtualizace v podnicích. Nová služba Acronis MDR s integrovanou obnovou po útoku.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Polovina českých firem si není jistá blízkou budoucnosti svého oboru, většina ale počítá s velkým vlivem AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Další teorie se chce obejít bez temné hmoty i energie. Grafenový inkoust pro levný a dostupný tisk senzorů. Navrhli novou metodu detekce prvních hvězd. Změřili gravitaci blízko kvantovému světu. HPE postavila nejvýkonnější superpočítač v Polsku.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Působivá simulace pádu do černé díry

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Je tady květen a ti, kdo se chystají sestavit si novou mašinu budou mít příležitost obětovat větší částku za hardwarové komponenty, nebo přidat si za nějaké další licence, které hned nenašli na Goodoffer24.com, zde mají velké slevy nabízené v porovnání s oficiálními ceníky.
articles.title: Květnový výprodej na Goodoffer24 nabízí Windows 11 Pro za €20 a mnoho dalších slev

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nové portfolio tiskáren HP navržené s ohledem na udržitelnost, bezpečnost i efektivitu práce. Posilování kybernetické odolnosti v éře umělé inteligence. Red Hat usnadňuje vytváření modelů AI. Platby výkupného za ransomware vzrostly za poslední rok na pětinásobek. 96 % firem má obavy o zabezpečení cloudů. Zároveň jim chybí odborníci.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Platby výkupného za ransomware vzrostly za poslední rok na pětinásobek

articles.description: U altermagnetů ověřili existenci jevu, který pomůže při výrobě čipů. Data o bosonu W nenašla žádnou fyziku za Standardním modelem. Nová studie zpochybňuje exoplanetu s životem produkujícím dimethylsulfid. Záznam starý 3,7 miliardy let ukazuje, že magnetické pole Země vzniklo rychle.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: O krok blíže k molekulárním počítačům

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kvalita a přesnost dat generovaných AI rozhodne o důvěře zaměstnanců v umělou inteligenci. Nejnovější generace počítačů HP Elite a HP Pro využívá potenciál umělé inteligence. Ness Czech pod křídly nového investora výrazně roste. IBM a její partneři. Pure představuje první externí blokové úložiště pro provoz VMware v cloudu Azure.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Kvalita a přesnost dat generovaných AI rozhodne o důvěře zaměstnanců v umělou inteligenci

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Framework Computer představila novou vylepšenou verzi svého modulárního notebooku Framework Laptop 13 s Intel Core Ultra Series 1, displej s lepším rozlišením a novou webovou kameru. Přímo do Česka jej zatím koupit nelze.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 2.16 svobodného video editoru Flowblade (GitHub, Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání. Videoukázky funkcí Flowblade na Vimeu. Instalovat lze také z Flathubu.

articles.description: TerminalTextEffects (TTE) je engine pro vizuální efekty v terminálu. Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na GitHubu pod licencí MIT.

articles.description: Od čtvrtka 30. 5. do soboty 1. 6. lze v Praze navštívit Veletrh vědy, tj. největší populárně naučnou akci v České republice, kterou každoročně od roku 2015 pořádá Akademie věd ČR. Vstup zdarma.

articles.description: Armbian, tj. linuxová distribuce založená na Debianu a Ubuntu optimalizovaná pro jednodeskové počítače na platformě ARM a RISC-V, ke stažení ale také pro Intel a AMD, byl vydán ve verzi 24.5.1 Havier. Přehled novinek v Changelogu.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Finálový zápas mistrovství světa v ledním hokeji přinesl nový rekord NIX.CZ (𝕏): "Dosavadní absolutní maximum našeho propojovacího uzlu bylo překonáno v čase 21:10, kdy jsme při přenosu dat dosáhli 3,14 Tbps. Je třeba také doplnit, že po deváté hodině večerní byly na maximu i ostatní datové přenosy nesouvisející s hokejovým šampionátem".

articles.description: Přihlaste svou přednášku na další ročník konference LinuxDays, který proběhne 12. a 13. října na FIT ČVUT v pražských Dejvicích. CfP poběží do konce prázdnin, pak proběhne veřejné hlasování a výběr přednášek.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara

articles.title: HealthyPi Move, open source biometrický monitor ve tvaru hodinek

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A massive uptick in traffic to Fedora's package mirrors is causing problems for the Linux distribution. Some five million additional systems have started putting additional strain on Fedora's mirror resources since March and appear to be coming from Amazon's cloud...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Framework is out today with some exciting announcements from lowering the price of the existing Framework 13 with AMD Ryzen 7040 series SoC to announcing a new Framework Laptop 13 powered by Intel Core Ultra (Meteor Lake) and having a new 2.8K display option for this modular/upgradeable laptop shipping this summer...
articles.title: Framework Announces Intel Core Ultra Powered Laptop With 2.8k Display

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Now that the Linux 6.10 merge window has wrapped up, here's a look at all of the exciting features/changes coming to this summer 2024 kernel. Linux 6.10 brings a lot as usual for the latest/upcoming Intel and AMD platforms, never-ending work on file-systems, a new memory sealing "mseal" system call, TPM bus encryption, and dozens of other exciting changes and new hardware support.
articles.title: Linux 6.10 Features Include TPM Bus Encryption, More AMD Zen 5 & A Prison Letter Merge Request

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Arm today announced the latest products in the Armv9 CPU portfolio: the Cortex-X925 as their "ultimate performance" processor and the Cortex-A725 as their processor option for sustained performance...
articles.title: Arm Announces The Cortex-X925 & Cortex-A725

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: QuestDB 8.0 is out today as the newest feature update to this open-source time-series database. QuestDB continues to cater to high throughput ingestion and fast SQL queries so it can handle use-cases from financial data to IoT sensors. With today's QuestDB 8.0 release, it's even faster...
articles.title: QuestDB 8.0 Brings Up To 50% Performance Improvement, ZFS Data Compression

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: KDE's Eco group announced today "Opt Green" as a new initiative for sustainable software...
articles.title: KDE Launches "Opt Green" Initiative For Sustainable Software & Hardware

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the newest open-source projects in-development by Ubuntu maker Canonical is a new C# written program called Flamenco...
articles.title: Canonical Developing "Flamenco" For Enhancing .NET Developer Experience On Ubuntu

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The AMD shader compiler "ACO" alternative to the AMDGPU LLVM back-end has seen another batch of changes merged in preparations for next-generation Radeon RDNA4 GPUs...
articles.title: Valve's AMD Shader Compiler "ACO" Makes More Preparations For Radeon RDNA4

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Coming up on my radar today is a commit made to the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) for adjusting the loop alignment with Intel's generic tuning path. In turn this should address "some random performance penalty in benchmarks" with coping better around cache lines...
articles.title: Intel Makes One Line Tweak To GCC To Fix A "Random Performance Penalty"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The past year there's been a big Linux kernel patch series in the work by Intel to improve Sub-NUMA Clustering "SNC" support so it behaves well with Intel Resource Director Technology (RDT) on modern Intel hardware. Hopefully that work will soon be ready for mainlining in the Linux kernel while this week brought the 19th revision to those patches...
articles.title: Intel's Sub-NUMA Clustering Support Linux Patches Spun A 19th Time

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Flowblade 2.16 is out today as the newest version of this open-source non-linear video editor...
articles.title: Flowblade 2.16 Open-Source Video Editor Released

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: SVT-AV1 that started out as an open-source AV1 video encoder at Intel and more recently an an Alliance of Open Media project quietly released SVT-AV1 v2.1 last week. With this new SVT-AV1 release are yet more performance optimizations and tuning...
articles.title: SVT-AV1 2.1 Released With Yet More Performance Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's open-source Linux graphics driver engineers continue to be quite busy preparing their Xe kernel driver and Mesa user-space ANV Vulkan / Iris Gallium3D driver for upcoming Lunar Lake processors. Merged today for Mesa 24.2-devel is more Lunar Lake platform enablement work plus early support for ray-tracing with the integrated Xe2 graphics. However, more work is still needed before this Lunar Lake / Xe2 support will be ready for end-users on the Linux desktop...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Microsoft's open-source DirectX Shader Compiler that is open-source and derived from the LLVM/Clang compiler infrastructure is out with a significant new release as it begins preparing for "HLSL 202x" as a big leap for the High-Level Shader Language...

articles.title: Chrome 127 Should Provide PipeWire Camera Capture Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Crucial last week announced the launch of their newest Crucial DDR5 Pro Memory: Overclocking (OC) Edition in white heatspreader form. Crucial recently sent over a pair of these 2 x 16GB Crucial Pro DDR5-6000 UDIMM memory kits that we've been putting through the paces with Intel Core i9 14900K and AMD Ryzen 9 7950X systems. These new Crucial Pro DIMMs have been working out very well and align with the great quality we've long enjoyed from Crucial/Micron.
articles.title: Crucial Pro DDR5-6000 32GB Memory Kit

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Sent out today as a fix for the Linux kernel's in-tree "cpupower" utility is properly handling P-State frequency reporting for upcoming AMD Zen 5 processors...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those continuing to rely on the Enterprise Linux 8 series, AlmaLinux 8.10 has made its stable debut this morning as the newest version of this community-oriented operating system derived from Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.10...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the new security features coming with Linux 6.10 is TPM bus encryption and integrity protection to fend off a wave of possible attacks against Trusted Platform Module recovery keys, TPM sniffing, etc. This functionality was merged for the Linux 6.10 merge window but is now being pulled back to x86_64-only by default where it's been sufficiently tested...

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: FreeBSD 14.1-RC1 is now available for testing as this incremental update to FreeBSD 14 prepares for its stable release in June...
articles.title: FreeBSD 14.1-RC1 Adds More Packages To The DVD Images - Including The Sway Compositor

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel Performance Limit Reasons (PLR) can indicate why your CPU is downclocking / limited to a lower performance limit for a given core or die. With some Windows utilities this information this Intel CPU feature has been available there while now Intel is bringing PLR support to Linux too...
articles.title: Intel Performance Limit Reasons For Linux To Report Why Your CPU Is Downclocking

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Intel Implicit SPMD Program Compiler (ISPC) is out with a new version today for this C programming language variant that features SPMD programming extensions. Intel ISPC aims to make it easy to take advantage of SIMD capabilities on their modern processors as well as GPUs...
articles.title: Intel Releases ISPC 1.24 With New AVX-VNNI & AVX512-VNNI Targets

articles.description: Linux kernel patches were posted today for enabling Linux to boot on the LicheeRV Nano, a mini single board computer that comes in at a mere 22.86 x 35.56 mm. As interesting as the size with this SBC is the Sophgo SG2002 SoC that features a mix of RISC-V and ARM cores...

articles.description: An end-user and Phoronix reader has taken up creating his own AMD ROCm SDK build system to make it easier to setup a machine learning software stack from scratch on AMD Radeon GPUs under Linux. This open-source build system pulls in the AMD ROCm source code as well as AMD GPU-accelerated tools like PyTorch and ONNX and makes it easier to deploy and without having to rely on Docker or other solutions...
articles.title: An End-User Has Made It Easier To Build ROCm & AMD GPU Machine Learning Software

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux 6.10-rc1 kernel was just released to top off the Linux 6.10 merge window...
articles.title: Linux 6.10-rc1 Kernel Released With Many New Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's open-source NPU "iVPU" Linux kernel driver for supporting their Neural Processing Unit beginning with Core Ultra "Meteor Lake" processors is already seeing a code refactoring. The refactoring of this Intel accelerator driver is intended for allowing more versatile CPU and NPU combinations moving forward...
articles.title: Intel NPU Driver Being Refactored For More Versatile CPU+NPU Handling

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the memory management "MM" updates merged for the Linux 6.10 there is now NUMA balancing support for multi-size transparent hugepages (THPs). This is yielding some nice performance results and there is also other work in this new kernel around multi-size THPs...
articles.title: Linux 6.10 Supports NUMA Balancing For Multi-Size THPs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the patch series that sadly was not ready in time for the Linux 6.10 merge window and thus will need to wait a few months for at least the next kernel is enabling AMD Fast CPPC support for Zen 4 processors. Fast CPPC aims to allow the processor to deliver higher performance at the same power consumption...
articles.title: Updated Patches For AMD "Fast CPPC" To Yield Higher Performance At Same Power Level

articles.author: Franklin Bellone Borges
articles.description:
Dim Forest can be considered one of the most tricky areas to explore early on in Wuthering Waves, but that's not because of its enemies. Instead, the reason lies in how the area's heart is filled with toxic spores that quickly force the Rover to back away.


To help all looking to explore the sub-region freely and get an extra Astrite sum, here's how to eliminate all of the Dim Forest toxic spores in Wuthering Waves. 


How to clear All of the Dim Forest Toxic Spores in Wuthering Waves


You can clear the toxic spores in WuWa by completing the When the Forest is No Longer Dim Exploration Quest. The quest will task the Rover with helping Qiaomu and the rest of the research team in their efforts to stop the spores' propagation and counter its effects. When the Forest is No Longer Dim will be…
articles.title: How to clear the Dim Forest Toxic Spores in Wuthering Waves

articles.description:
Critical Countdown is the first event of Season 4, kicking off a challenge tied to DNA samples. We're here to show all the challenges and rewards in the MW3 and Warzone Critical Countdown event, including how to play it.


MW3 and Warzone Critical Countdown event guide


In the Critical Countdown event, the key to unlocking rewards lies in obtaining DNA samples from fallen enemies in MW3 Multiplayer and Zombies. Loot caches in Warzone also hold these valuable samples, so it's crucial to scavenge as much as possible. There are two types of DNA samples: Ade and Cyto. However, Operators must amass a specific quantity to unlock the following rewards in the MW3 and Warzone Critical Countdown event:


DNA Samples Needed
Rewards




390 Ade
Double XP Token


780 Ade
Double Weapon XP Token


1,560…

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
Even if you're a casual gamer, you've almost certainly at least heard of the Elder Scrolls series. A quick recap: it's a fantasy-based RPG franchise created by the Maryland studio Bethesda, beginning with Arena in 1994 and going all the way to the 2023 mobile game, The Elder Scrolls: Castles.


Over time, it's become one of the most successful role-playing series ever, turning its developer into an industry powerhouse. But say you've never played one before. Which Elder Scrolls game do you start with? There are five mainline entries so far, as well as an MMO set in the same universe, not to mention all the expansions and spinoffs.


While it's important to understand that it doesn't technically matter which order you play them in – as each installment has its own storyline – I've got some …
articles.title: Which mainline Elder Scrolls game should you start with?

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Upgrading your weapons and Echoes is part of making a powerful team in Wuthering Waves. Scarletthorn is a resource you'll use to craft weapons, allowing you to potentially get a few upgrades if you recently acquired a new character.


Where to find Scarletthorn Ore in Wuthering Waves


Scarletthorn ore spawns in most regions around Wuthering Waves' map, with the locations below having numerous clusters of them:



In Desorock Highland, around the Thundering Memphis boss


In the Central Plains, around the Tempest Memphis boss and northwest of the Tower of Adversity


North of the Dim Forest


In the northeastern and southeastern parts of Whining Aix's Mire



If you're traveling around the northern half of the map, you'll spot several Scarletthorn spawns, especially in the Central Plains o…
articles.title: How to get Scarletthorn Ore in Wuthering Waves – best farming location

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
There are many seasonal events held throughout the year in Final Fantasy XIV, and it can be hard to keep up with what's coming and going. To help sort your schedule, we've got a rolling list of the usual FFXIV events, timing estimates, and even speculation about what's to come. 


Below, we'll outline the FFXIV 2024 calendar's confirmed and tentative event schedule — along with some events that may have wrapped up for the year. Additionally, you can check out the MMO's usual calendar too, along with a little explainer on each of the year's festivities. 


The FFXIV 2024 event calendar


It’s hard to give an exact date for every event, as the timing changes a little every year, and there’s no guessing when irregular events (such as The Maiden’s Rhapsody) may return. That being said, there a…
articles.title: Every seasonal FFXIV event, ongoing and scheduled for 2024

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Call of Duty Season 4 unveils a series of exclusive Weekly Challenges, each one a key to unlocking the prestigious Shear Modulus camo. The first week brings another unique Aftermarket Part reward, but you'll need to conquer at least five tasks to claim it. For a tantalizing glimpse, here are all the MW3 and Warzone Season 4 Week 1 challenges and their coveted rewards.





All MW3 Season 4 Week 1 challenges


MW3's Week 1 challenges offer a diverse range of tasks, with a primary focus on Recommended Assault Rifles. But if you're a fan of long-range attacks, at least one challenge features a Marksman Rifle, catering to your preferred playstyle.

Rewards




Get 40 Operator Kills shortly after Sprinting with Recommended Assault Rifles

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XIV is available to absolutely everyone, to an extent. The free trial now includes Stormblood, allowing you to level most jobs to level 70. However, the free trial is limited in terms of features and once it ends, requires a subscription to keep playing. 


The free trial of Final Fantasy XIV is great when it comes to telling whether the game is worth purchasing, but it comes with limitations. While on the free trial, players cannot:



Purchase some items (such as gift items) from the FFXIV Online Store


Possess more than 300,000 Gil


Use /shout, /yell, or /tell chat options


Access the Marketboard


Trade with other players


Send in-game letters using the Moogle Delivery Service


Hire retainers


Create Linkshells, either on home world or cross-world


Create or join a…
articles.title: Final Fantasy XIV subscription tier costs explained

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
The quote, "the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown," can be attributed to either H.P. Lovecraft or an evil cosmic entity posing as him. There's truth to it, and one of the best ways for horror aficionados who no longer get a kick from cookie-cutter American horror movies to rekindle their love for the genre is by watching movies made in different countries.


These movies teach us that there are different techniques and approaches to filmmaking that will catch us off guard, and also that the language of horror is universal and will cross any frontier to get you.


Image via Shudder


Cuando Acecha La Maldad (When Evil Lurks) - Argentina, 2023


When Evil Lurks offers one of the most original takes on possession horror that you'll ever see. Don't expect to see a good e…
articles.title: The ten scariest foreign language horror movies

articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Covert Sneakers are widely considered the best Boots in Modern Warfare 3, so Sledgehammer Games responded in Season 4 by decreasing the volume of enemy footsteps to devalue using the perk. 


As part of the Season 4 update, all enemies have quieter footsteps. Since Covert Sneakers eliminates footstep audio, it's rendered redundant, considering everyone makes less noise. This comes after Sledgehammer Games already attempted to overhaul the Boots category in Season 3 Reloaded. 


The developer removed Climbing Boots and introduced All-Terrain Boots, which offer significantly increased movement speed at the cost of tactical sprinting. In addition, Running Sneakers received a buff to improve sprint to fire time by 25 percent while tactical sprinting, and Stalker Boots were buffed to increase strafe speed and decreased the bounciness of aiming down sight. Those changes didn't do enough to satisfy the development team. 


Image via Activision


"Last season, we made several adjustments to Perks to distribute usage in the Boots category more evenly," Sledgehammer Games said. "Despite these changes, the pick rate of Covert Sneakers remains far ahead of other Boots." 


After this Season 4 change and the buffs from a previous update, there are plenty of compelling options worth considering. Taking everything into consideration, the best Boots option is now Stalker Boots as they give you faster strafing and ADS speed. Running Sneakers are also a viable choice as they increase tactical sprinting duration and reduce the refresh time.


The indirect nerf to Covert Sneakers will also impact the Call of Duty League. Reports suggest that Major 4 will be played on the latest patch, meaning we could see pro players experiment with other perks. Either way, the next time you load into a match, don't be afraid to try out a new Boots option.

The post MW3 Season 4 change pushes players away from using Covert Sneakers appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: MW3 Season 4 change pushes players away from using Covert Sneakers

articles.description:
It's finally here. After three weeks, Destiny 2 players can finish crafting the reprised Outbreak Perfected. Outbreak Refined III is a short chain of missions with the most difficult part being locating two switches in the labryinthe Zero Hour mission and completing the run within 20 minutes. Here's how to beat it with no wasted time searching.


Where to find the final pair of switches in Destiny 2 Zero Hour


Just like the previous two quests in this chain, you'll need to speak with Ada-1 in the Tower's Annex to acquire the Outbreak Refined III quest. Should you be skipping ahead or planning on rushing through them before The Final Shape is released, here are the other two guides.



Outbreak Refined I


Outbreak Refined II



The first step in Outbreak Refined III requires defeating Fallen in The Devils' Lair strike to collect Inert SIVA Clusters. This can be launched by selecting it from the Cosmodrome map in the Director. I had this complete by the time my fireteam reached Sepiks Prime, so you shouldn't have to worry about multiple runs.



Image by Destructoid


Image by Destructoid



As for the switches themselves, they're on the wall section. Instead of jumping left like you normally would, go right to find the first switch. From there, head left as you normally would. Once you reach the final drain, there will be a series of small pipes with grates on them, stacked three high. Jump all the way to the top for the second switch.


From there, it's just a matter of completing Zero Hour on Legend. Since this final pair of switches isn't out of the way, your fireteam shouldn't have too much difficulty hitting them and then taking down the boss.

The post How to complete Outbreak Refined III in Destiny 2 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to complete Outbreak Refined III in Destiny 2

The latest update to Anime Defenders added an exceptionally powerful evolution to the already strong Mythical unit Skull Warrior. With this update, you can now evolve your Skull Warrior unit into an even better unit. Here is how to evolve Skull Warrior in Anime Defenders into a Skull Paladin.


Screenshot by Destructoid


How to evolve Skull Warrior into Skull Paladin


You can evolve your Skull Warrior unit into a Skull Paladin by using a Skull Mask. Once you have crafted the Skull Mask item, simply combine it with your Skull Warrior unit to evolve it into the Skull Paladin. The Skull Paladin is a more powerful evolution of the Skull Warrior, and is also a Mythical rarity unit. You can evolve the Skull Warrior by visiting the Evolving circle inside of the Summon shop in the main hub.


The Skull Paladin is a Gound type unit that starts with full AoE capability and upgrades to have added Circle and Line attacks. Here are all the stats for a Skull Paladin:



How to obtain: Evolve from Skull Warrior by using a Skull Mask


Deployment Cost: 1,500


Total Upgrade Cost: 71,000 over 12 upgrades


Attack Patterns:

Level 1-2 - Full AoE


Level 3-4 - Circle


Level 5-8 - Line


Level 9-10 - Circle


Level 11-12 - Line





How to craft a Skull Mask in Anime Defenders


Since you need a Skull Mask to evolve your Skull Warrior into a Skull Paladin, you're going to have to craft one. The craft requires you to have a variety of Star Rifts as well as 25,000 Gold. Once you have all the required materials, visit the Crafting circle located inside the Summon shop in the main hub. Here are all the materials required to craft a Skull Mask in Anime Defenders:



28 Yellow Star Rifts


6 Red Star Rifts


6 Blue Star Rifts


4 Green Star Rifts


2 Rainbow Star Rifts


25,000 Gold

The Euro 2024 promo could be a surprise hit with EA FC 24 Ultimate Team players and breathe new life into it following the TOTS celebrations.


Euro 2024 will kick off in June and pit the best of Europe against each other. To celebrate this special tournament, EA Sports is reportedly planning to release an exclusive promo in Ultimate Team. While the developers have remained tight-lipped as of this writing, FUT Scoreboard, a reliable source for leaks in the past, has provided the information on X.


When will the Euro 2024 promo release in EA FC 24?


For now, it's all speculation, but our best guess places a Euro 24 promo for EA FC 24 on June 14. The actual Euro 2024 begins on June 14, too, with the first contest featuring Germany and Scotland. We're assuming it'll go live around the same time, putting it a week after the EA FC 24 TOTS promo ends on June 7.


As things stand, it's unclear what plans EA Sports has for the unique promo. The upcoming set of cards could create the same frenzy we saw earlier in FIFA 23 when the World Cup-themed items were released. For the time being, it's best to wait patiently until EA Sports makes the news official. 




There haven't been many rumors so far, as the TOTS promo is active. However, the leaks indicate that the Euro 2024 promo could have its own versions of Heroes and Icons. The Heroes and Icons are always pretty popular, and a new version will certainly incentivize many players to continue playing after the TOTS promo.


It will be interesting to find out which footballers will get unique cards in EA FC 24 as part of the Euro promo. For the time being, players can start preparing for the Ultimate TOTS promo, which goes live on Friday, May 31. It will feature some of the best rewards from the previous TOTS lineups and give the community a great chance to get their hands on some really strong items.

The post Will EA FC 24 have a Euro 2024 promo? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Will EA FC 24 have a Euro 2024 promo?

articles.author: Drew Kopp
articles.description:
A new trailer for the second season of NieR: Automata Ver1.1a just dropped, bringing exciting new information about the second course of NieR: Automata's beautiful but beleaguered anime adaptation to the series' fans. Among these new tidbits was an estimated release window of July 2024.


Carrying the weight of the world




According to the trailer, which premiered simultaneously on X and Aniplex's official YouTube page, the second season of NieR: Automata Ver1.1a will premiere sometime in July of this year. If the first season of NieR: Automata Ver1.1a is anything to go off of, the second season will feature a total of twelve episodes, meaning that its run will probably wrap up in either August or September, depending on when in July it premieres.


While the second season is currently set to be released in the summer, NieR: Automata Ver1.1a developed a reputation for its production schedule. The first season was infamously marred with COVID-related production issues that caused it to be delayed twice, so NieR fans have a right to be a little skeptical about the schedule for the second phase of 2B and 9S's adventures.


The first season of NieR: Automata Ver1.1a adapted a version of the game's story through Endings A and B, which are only two of the five endings that players need to arrive at to gain a complete understanding of NieR's events. Given what we see in the trailer, the second cour will likely adapt Endings C through E, which completely flip the story of NieR: Automata on its head and turn what appears to be a story of humanoid androids warring against robots into something a bit more complicated.

The post NieR: Automata anime’s second season slots in for July premiere appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: NieR: Automata anime’s second season slots in for July premiere

articles.author: Cameron Woolsey
articles.description:
You're gunning it to the dropship with samples in tow. But before you hop in, the host blasts you and kicks you from the game, leaving you in your ship with nothing. Lobby kickers have been an issue for the Helldivers 2 community, but a solution is being worked on. 


At least one is according to Arrowhead Games community manager, Thomas "Twinbeard" Petersson. Last week, in a reply on the game's official Discord to a question about what to do with "arsehole lobby" kickers, Petersson said the team is figuring something out. 


"We're actually working on a solution to mitigate problems with, well, 'getting kicked by an arsehole lobby leader' as someone once eloquently put it," Petersson said. "No ETA on that, but it's coming."





A solution to butthead lobby kickers is coming to Helldivers 2


The lobby kicker issue has been a thorn for community members for some time. I've read complaints about it on the official Helldivers 2 subreddit since the game arrived. There are no penalties for kicking players without a reason in the game; in fact, it's relatively easy to do. I've been kicked from games before, but thankfully it wasn't due to a griefing lobby leader. At least a few have the courtesy to let you know first. 





Johan Pilestedt, the CCO of Arrowhead Games, commented on the situation before. In a message on X back in March, Pilestedt said the issue was "very hard to solve - we have some ideas but no conclusion." Pilestedt continued, asking for ideas from the community "Hive Mind."




Perhaps one of those ideas shared to the team was good enough to work on. Some have suggested offering kicked players some share in the experience points and Reference Slips — one ideal solution. It's been a couple of months since the aforementioned message, and it doesn't sound like the fix is around the corner. But, hopefully, it's close. 

The post A solution to deal with Helldivers 2 lobby kickers is on its way appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: A solution to deal with Helldivers 2 lobby kickers is on its way
